title: Fairytale
content: The intertwining of fantasy and reality in different time periods from different characters perspectives makes this a must read. A true page turner. Each chapter makes you wanting more. Although there is some violence it is more of a fantastical story with a mention of what actually happened to women through history.

title: Verified Purchase

title: The Magic of Books
content: I loved this book so much that I just bought another from this author today.  The story is so captivating.  Loved Opaline so much and her troubles were heartbreaking.  It was told with so much emotion and the character was so resilient.  I can't say much more without spoilers.  This book was pure magic from start to finish and cannot wait to read the next one in my queue.  Thank you Evie for such a wonderful story.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This book was wonderful. I enjoyed following the characters as they developed and not being confused by it. Not sure what year was was for Martha, but seemed more present day. The past lives of the characters had a thread of similarities that made everything fit so perfectly together. All lives were wrapped up nicely and left me thinking. I hope she‚Äôs written other stories.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024

title: Great story telling
content: Wow! This is a page turner! I couldn't soak it up fast enough. What a truly wonderful read, the imagination goes wild with this one.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: ....complex story taking place, back-and-forth across 100+ years and focused on the esoteric profession of rare books dealing. Mystery and a little magic wind it's way through the story as well as some not so pleasant reminders that 100 years ago, women were largely seen as property with no individual rights. There are several "main" characters, so I won't describe them all, as even the fleeting, temporary ones are quite important in their times.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2024

title: loved this book
content: But predominantly, it is two women -- Opaline, in the early 20th century, and Martha, contemporary to now. Weirdly, they are each looking for the other in a way. Martha is helped by (or is helping) Henry in this effort as he struggles to write his thesis.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: TBH, some aspects of the story just aren't explained or, at least not explained well, or just inexplicably exist. For example, Martha's very recent past seems like it would preclude allowing anything like the exceptionally strange tattoo on her back.

title: What a wonderful story!
content: Dust jackets and synopses can tell you about the book, but not about the feelings or emotions invoked  from reading it. This one left me feeling sad that it was over but thrilled that I'd read it.  And hopeful that through words on paper, anything is possible.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This was a pretty intriguing story.  I wasn‚Äôt sure how it was all going to connect until the very end which is what kept me reading.  I have read other reviews that talk about how this book touches on Irish folklore.  I wish that could have been explained a little bit more for someone who is not familiar.  I think this book was more literary fiction with a essence of magic and mystery.  I enjoyed it and will look to read another book by the author.  The story was very unique.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024

title: Unique story
content: A lost bookshop is a fanciful idea - a bookshop that was once there, and is no longer. The wonderfully strong women and their journeys add so much to this story. Their persistence, their strength, the sheer magic of their existence make this story simply enchanting. And make no mistake, Henry is a significant piece of the puzzle too.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I‚Äôm not sure what I expected from this story - maybe more about the bookstore and less about the people. But Evie Woods crafts it all with such beauty and grace the story simply glows with life, the energy of the tale a thing unto itself.
